dfischer.utils

Class SMTPUtilityReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • java.io.BufferedReader
        • dfischer.utils.CommandInputLineReader
          • dfischer.utils.SMTPUtilityReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable

    public class SMTPUtilityReader
extends CommandInputLineReader
    Utility which allows to send a bulk of emails to one or several SMTP servers.
    See "Application Reference Manual" for a detailed description.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SMTPUtilityReader(java.io.Reader in)
      Creates a new instance which reads the SMTP definition data.
      SMTPUtilityReader(java.io.Reader in, int sz)
      Creates a new instance which reads the SMTP definition data.

    • Method Detail

      • setParseOnly

        public void setParseOnly(boolean parseOnly)
        Allows to verify the definition data without sending emails.
        Parameters:
        parseOnly - if true verify the definition data without sending emails (default = false)

      • setLogVerbose

        public void setLogVerbose(boolean logVerbose)
        Enables verbose logging.
        Parameters:
        logVerbose - if true verbose logging is enabled (default = false)

      • setLogStream

        public void setLogStream(java.io.PrintStream logStream)
        Allows to set an alternative log stream.
        Parameters:
        logStream - log stream (default = System.out)

      • setVar

        public void setVar(java.lang.String varName,
          java.lang.String varValue)
        Defines a variable which can be used in the definition data.
        Parameters:
        varName - name of the variable. Note: all variable names must start with a $ (dollar sign).
        varValue - value of the variable. Note: a null value deletes the variable
